iti109:0.3: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
iti109:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti109:2.1: “Suppose a person was being carried along by a river current that seemed nice and pleasant.
iti109:2.2: If a person with good eyesight saw them, they’d say:
iti109:2.3: ‘Mister, even though the river current carrying you along seems nice and pleasant, downstream there is a lake with waves and whirlpools, sharks and monsters. When you reach there it will result in death or deadly pain.’
